titleInfo.title: Participants in UT's 1940 Rose Bowl Appearance

mods.abstract: View of various acquaintances of the 1940 UT football team at the time of their trip to the Rose Bowl. In the front are (left to right) Jack Joyner (UT publicity director), Walter Stewart (representing the Memphis Commercial Appeal), Fred Russell (representing the Nashville Banner), Virgie Wacks (representing twelve Tennessee newspapers), George Bugsee (representing the Memphis Press Scimitar), and Raymond Johnson (representing the Nashville Tennesseean). In the back are Clarence Brown (UT alumnus and Chairman of California Arrangements for the UT football team), Ann Morris, Major Robert Neyland (UT football coach), Florence Rice, and Lana Turner. The football team made this visit to the Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer studio as guests of Clarence Brown and Louis B. Mayer.

location.physicalLocation: University of Tennessee, Knoxville. Special Collections
